title: Sasihithlu Beach
sneakPeek: The surfing capital of Karnataka.
details:
-Located north of Mangalore, where the river meets the sea (estuary).
-Famous for hosting the Indian Open of Surfing.
-Pristine white sands and clear water make it one of the most beautiful beaches.
-Less commercialized, offering a raw and natural beach experience.

title: Panambur Beach
sneakPeek: The most popular beach for sunsets and water sports.
details:
-Known as one of the cleanest and safest beaches in India.
-Famous for its annual International Kite Festival held in January.
-Offers water sports like jet skiing, surfing, and boat rides.
-A perfect spot for a family picnic with plenty of food stalls around.

title: Tannirbhavi Beach
sneakPeek: A serene beach famous for its Tree Park.
details:
-Less crowded than Panambur, offering a peaceful sunset experience.
-Features a 15-hectare 'Tree Park' with sculptures and medicinal plants.
-Accessible via a scenic ferry ride from Sultan Battery.
-Known for its blue waters and golden sands.

title: Surathkal Lighthouse Beach
sneakPeek: Famous for its lighthouse on the rocks.
details:
-Located near NITK Surathkal, about 15km from the city.
-Features a historic lighthouse built on a rocky hillock that you can climb for a view.
-The beach has unique rock formations and golden sands.
-A favorite hangout spot for students and photographers.

title: Someshwar Beach
sneakPeek: Known for the giant 'Rudra Shile' rocks.
details:
-Located in Ullal, famous for the large rock formations called 'Rudra Shile'.
-The Someshwara Temple is situated right on the shore overlooking the sea.
-Swimming is often restricted here due to strong currents and rocks.
-Offers one of the most dramatic sunset views in Mangalore.

title: Ullal Beach
sneakPeek: Historic beach with golden sands and palms.
details:
-Located near the Summer Sands Beach Resort.
-One of the oldest and most historic beaches in the region.
-Offers a long coastline with casuarina groves providing shade.
-Close to the famous Ullal Dargah and Rani Abbakka's fort ruins.

title: Hosabettu Beach
sneakPeek: A clean, hidden gem with a long walkway.
details:
-A pristine and less crowded beach located near Surathkal.
-Features a long, paved walkway perfect for evening jogs and walks.
-Known for its cleanliness and peaceful atmosphere.
-Great for families looking to avoid the crowds of Panambur.

title: Bengre Beach
sneakPeek: A quiet stretch of sand near the estuary.
details:
-Located on the Tannirbhavi side of the peninsula.
-Very secluded and quiet, ideal for those who love silence.
-Close to the breakwater and the shipbuilding yard.
-Offers a raw, untouched beach experience.

title: Pilikula Nisargadhama
sneakPeek: A massive nature park with a zoo and lake.
details:
-A one-stop destination featuring a biological park (zoo), botanical garden, and science center.
-Includes a large lake with boating facilities and a heritage village.
-Home to the Pilikula 3D Planetarium, the first of its kind in India.
-Perfect for a full-day trip with family and kids.

title: Kadri Park
sneakPeek: The largest garden in the city with a musical fountain.
details:
-A beautiful park located on Kadri Hills, perfect for morning walks.
-Features a toy train and a musical fountain show in the evenings.
-Hosts the famous annual 'Karavali Utsav' flower show.
-Surrounded by lush greenery and located near the famous Kadri Temple.

title: Tagore Park
sneakPeek: Panoramic views from Lighthouse Hill.
details:
-Located at the historic Light House Hill in the city center.
-Home to a lighthouse built by Haider Ali in the 18th century.
-Ideally situated for watching the sunset over the Arabian Sea.
-A favorite hangout for students from the nearby colleges.

title: Gandhi Park
sneakPeek: A historic park located near Town Hall.
details:
-A well-maintained park situated in the heart of the city.
-Features a statue of Mahatma Gandhi and beautiful landscaping.
-A quiet green space amidst the bustling city markets.
-Often used for cultural gatherings and peaceful evening walks.

title: Saripalla View Point
sneakPeek: A hidden hilltop with a panoramic view of the city.
details:
-A lesser-known trekking spot offering a stunning 360-degree view of Mangalore.
-Located in the Kulshekar area, it is perfect for watching sunrises and sunsets.
-The lush green hills make it a favorite spot for photographers and nature lovers.
-Best visited early in the morning or late evening.

title: Mangaluru Airport View Point
sneakPeek: Watch airplanes land amidst a scenic valley.
details:
-Located in Kenjar, near the Bajpe International Airport.
-Offers a thrilling view of the runway and flights taking off and landing.
-The viewpoint is situated on a hill, providing a backdrop of lush green valleys.
-A popular evening hangout spot for locals.

title: Netravati View Point
sneakPeek: Scenic views of the bridge and river.
details:
-Located near the Jeppinamogaru area along the Netravati River banks.
-Famous for the view of trains passing over the massive railway bridge against the sunset.
-A peaceful spot for a walk along the riverside promenade.
-Best visited during the golden hour.

title: Adyar View Point
sneakPeek: A scenic hilltop overlooking the Netravati River.
details:
-Located on the outskirts of the city near Adyar.
-Offers a breathtaking top-angle view of the meandering Netravati River and coconut groves.
-Features the famous Adyar Falls nearby (seasonal).
-A quiet, non-commercialized spot perfect for solitude.

title: Dakke View Point
sneakPeek: The bustling heart of Mangalore's fishing harbor.
details:
-Located in Bunder, this is the main fishing harbor of the city.
-Offers a raw and vibrant view of hundreds of colorful fishing boats and trawlers.
-You can watch the auctioning of fresh catch early in the morning.
-Offers a unique view of the estuary where the river meets the sea.

title: Dambel
sneakPeek: Kayaking and beautiful backwaters.
details:
-Located in Ashok Nagar, Dambel is known for its calm backwaters.
-Famous for kayaking and boating activities.
-You can take a local boat ride from here to reach Tannirbhavi Beach.
-A serene spot to watch the sunset over the Gurupura River.

title: Sunset Point Bengre
sneakPeek: Where the river meets the Arabian Sea.
details:
-Located at the tip of the Bengre peninsula.
-This is the estuary point where the Gurupura River merges with the Arabian Sea.
-Offers a stunning view of the breakwater rocks and the endless ocean.
-A very quiet spot, perfect for fishing and sunset watching.

title: Clock Tower
sneakPeek: A historic landmark in the heart of the city.
details:
-Located in Hampankatta, this towering structure is a symbol of old Mangalore.
-Originally built in the colonial era, demolished, and then rebuilt to restore heritage.
-Illuminated beautifully at night with changing LED lights.
-A central meeting point and a great spot for street photography.

title: New Mangalore Port
sneakPeek: The gateway to Karnataka's maritime trade.
details:
-One of the major ports in India, located at Panambur.
-Best viewed from Panambur Beach where you can see massive cargo ships docking.
-Cruises from around the world dock here during the tourism season.
-A vital economic hub handling coffee, cashew, and petroleum exports.

title: Mangalore International Airport
sneakPeek: A hilltop airport with scenic table-top runways.
details:
-Located in Kenjar, it is one of only two table-top airports in India.
-The drive to the airport offers scenic views of winding roads and valleys.
-Famous for its modern terminal and the stunning approach view during landing.
-Connects Mangalore to the Middle East and major Indian cities.

title: Sultan Battery
sneakPeek: Historic watchtower with a river view.
details:
-Built by Tipu Sultan in 1784 to prevent warships from entering the Gurupura River.
-The watchtower looks like a miniature fortress and offers a stunning view of the backwaters.
-It serves as the starting point for the ferry to Tannirbhavi Beach.
-A great spot for history buffs and photographers.

title: Aloyseum (St. Aloysius Museum)
sneakPeek: A treasure trove of antiques and rare artifacts.
details:
-Located within the St. Aloysius College campus.
-Famous for its collection of ancient cars, swords, and the first generator of Mangalore.
-Houses rare coins, tribal artifacts, and European paintings.
-A must-visit for history buffs interested in the colonial past of the region.

title: Bejai Museum
sneakPeek: The only government museum in Mangalore.
details:
-Resembles a ship from the outside, located in the heart of Bejai.
-Houses a rich collection of ancient idols, paintings, and historical inscriptions.
-Surrounded by a quiet garden, making it a peaceful educational trip.

title: Mangalore Central Railway Station
sneakPeek: Historic railway terminus with Kerala-style architecture.
details:
-One of the oldest railway stations in the region, connecting Mangalore to Kerala and Chennai.
-Famous for its unique red-tiled sloping roof architecture.
-The entrance features a beautiful garden and a heritage steam engine display.

title: Town Hall
sneakPeek: The cultural epicenter of Mangalore.
details:
-The premier venue for all major cultural, Yakshagana, and theatre performances in the city.
-Located centrally near the Service Bus Stand.
-Renovated recently with modern acoustics and seating.

title: TMA Pai Convention Centre
sneakPeek: A world-class venue for grand events.
details:
-Located on MG Road, this is one of the largest convention centers in the city.
-Named after the visionary Dr. T.M.A. Pai.
-Hosts grand weddings, international conferences, and major exhibitions.
-Known for its massive auditorium and modern architecture.

title: PVS Building
sneakPeek: A legendary commercial landmark and circle.
details:
-Standing at the busy PVS Circle, this building is a key navigational landmark in Mangalore.
-Houses the famous 'PVS Kalakunja', an art gallery and exhibition hall.
-Known historically for the PVS Beedi industry headquarters.
-A central hub connecting MG Road, Kodialbail, and Bunts Hostel.

title: University College
sneakPeek: Heritage Indo-Saracenic architecture.
details:
-Located in Hampankatta, this college building is a heritage structure over 150 years old.
-Features the stunning 'Ravindra Kalabhavana', a heritage hall with stone arches.
-Originally the Government Arts College, it has a rich academic history.
-A beautiful example of laterite stone architecture.

title: DC Office
sneakPeek: The administrative seat with colonial charm.
details:
-The Deputy Commissioner's office is a majestic heritage building near State Bank.
-Built during the British era, it overlooks the old port area.
-Features classic red-brick architecture and expansive corridors.
-The center of administration for the Dakshina Kannada district.
